item.title: Magellan Pipeline Settles Alleged Clean Water Act Violations Related to Spills in Texas, Nebraska and Kansas
item.dc:creator: Headquarters, Enforcement and Compliance Assurance (OECA)

item.title: EPA and FDA Issue Final Fish Consumption Advice
item.description: WASHINGTON - Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters, Water (OW)

item.title: La FDA y la EPA publican consejos finales sobre el consumo de pescado
item.description: Hoy, la Agencia de Protección Ambiental de EE.UU. (EPA, por sus siglas en inglés) y la Administración de Medicamentos y Alimentos de EE.UU. (FDA, por sus siglas en inglés) publicaron sus consejos finales referentes al consumo de pescado.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters, Water (OW)

item.title: Bandit Industries, Inc., Settles Alleged Clean Air Act Violations for Manufacturing and Selling Wood Processing Equipment That Failed to Meet Emissions Standards
item.description: WASHINGTON — The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) today announced a settlement with Bandit Industries, Inc., for alleged violations of the Clean Air Act for selling non-road diesel engines and equipment used to process wood and waste that do not meet federal standards.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters, Enforcement and Compliance Assurance (OECA)

item.title: Tauber Oil Company Settles Allegations of Selling Unregistered Fuel Additive in Violation of Clean Air Act
item.description: WASHINGTON -- The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) today announced a settlement with Tauber Oil Company, resolving alleged Clean Air Act violations stemming from the company's sale of a fuel additive that was not registered with the EPA.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters, Enforcement and Compliance Assurance (OECA)

item.title: EPA Awards $12.7 Million to Assist Small Drinking Water and Wastewater Systems
item.description: WASHINGTON – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is awarding $12.7 million in grants to help small drinking and wastewater systems and private well owners.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters, Water (OW)

item.title: For the First Time in 40 Years EPA to Put in Place a Process to Evaluate Chemicals that May Pose Risk
item.description: WASHINGTON--The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is moving swiftly to propose how it will prioritize and evaluate chemicals, given that the final processes must be in place within the first year of the new law’s enactment, or before June 22, 2017.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters

item.title: Carbon Pollution Standards for Cars and Light Trucks to Remain Unchanged Through 2025
item.description: WASHINGTON — Today, EPA Administrator Gina McCarthy finalized her decision to maintain the current greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions standards for model years 2022-2025 cars and light trucks.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters

item.title: 11:00 AM EST: EPA To Make Announcement Today Regarding Major Automaker
item.description: WASHINGTON – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency will host a media call at 11 a.m. EST today, Thursday, January 12, to make an announcement regarding a major automaker.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters, Air and Radiation (OAR), Enforcement and Compliance Assurance (OECA)

item.title: U.S. EPA to Discuss Report Showing Significant Drop in Air Pollution from Toxic Chemicals in Thursday Media Webinar
item.description: WASHINGTON – Industrial facilities covered under the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency’s Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) program are reporting a substantial decrease in releases of toxic chemicals into the environment between 2005 and 2015.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters, Chemical Safety and Pollution Prevention (OCSPP)
